page.title: 11BIOGRAPHY NETT'M OLD PERSON.
page.content: Since 1934,Mrs Rose Hill has seen Nettleham change.Fields surrounded the small village,few owned cars.Taylors the Grocers occupied the Coop site. Milk was delivered by small cart, measured into jugs from a can.Both milk and Kettles bread were cheap. Children started school at 5 years, staying till 14,unless a scholarship took them to De Aston or South Park. Boys wore boots.Childrens games were skipping,or whip and top.Adults enjoyed,dominoes,cards,knitting and picnics.The old school had bucket toilets.Homes were often rented,using well water,and candles or oillamp. Gardens grew vegetables,including beans to salt for winter.Babies were at home.Feared illnesses were smallpox typhoid or polio.The poor dreaded the Work House.Sunday was still a special day,with best clothes for church.
